hi and welcome you listening to the x22

the economy was just nudged into
collapsing this was done on purpose
let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now we are seeing
incredible indicators letting us know
that this economy it is about to come
down and I believe the central bank
Trump they all notice they all know that
the manipulation that's been going on
well it's about to end and when manoosh
in came out and he said you know we're
gonna push for a weak dollar policy that
was done on purpose that whole thing was
done on purpose to nudge the economy and
we're gonna be getting into that in a

now is things are rapidly falling apart
and normally when this happens we see it
in the housing market we see it in
retail we see it in the in the everyday
person's life where you can see it you
can taste it you can feel it you know
what's going on and you can see this
happening in all different areas now a
lot of people believe that this is not
happening a lot of people think that
everything is great and everyone thought
the same exact thing prior to 2008
everyone was like what are you talking
about I'm buying another house I'm
taking out another loan I'm buying
another car everything is fantastic I
don't feel like anything is wrong
actually when Obama became running
McCain was that they're saying the
economy was incredibly strong everything
was great
there are no problems whatsoever and
once again we know that turned out to be
alive we know that the head of the Fed
at the time Bernanke he was out there
saying that we're not forecasting any
type of recession in the same year the
market came down so we know that these
people lie we know that they never tell
the truth and this is why we look at the
data this is why we look at what
really going on not what the government
is feeding us not what the stock market
is doing not what the corporate media
tells us we look at other information
now we're looking at housing right now
and we know that Case Shiller they look
at 20 cities and from these 20 cities
they tell us how the housing market is
doing and according to the latest BLS
BLS data the average hourly wages for
all US workers in November rose around
2.5 percent relative to the previous
year well below the feds target of 3.5
to 4.5% now this is kind of weird
because the unemployment number is at
4.1 percent and they're saying that
there's no slack in the economy and
since there's no slack in the economy it
fails to boost wage growth and this is
something where they're looking at it
saying this doesn't even make sense
now what we are seeing here is that the
housing market the prices of homes
they're going up so quickly that wages
are not keeping up whatsoever which
means the everyday person is being left
behind they can't afford these homes now
remember they're pushing the bubbles up
in these 20 cities this is being done on
purpose to make it look like everything
is great and they're doing in the
they're doing this in Seattle Las Vegas
San Francisco San Diego tamper Denver
Detroit Dallas Los Angeles New York
Phoenix Atlanta Miami you know all the
cities and they use these cities to say
look how great everything is
and of course right now we are just 1%
of the record highs from 2006 remember
when everyone said oh good times they're
gonna last forever and we're in 2006 and
it was the height of the housing market
and people were renting them out taking
out extra loans well the prices of homes
right now they're 1% shy of the top here
now what's very interesting about all of
this in all these different cities that
they're telling us you know
look at the housing prices because when
people hear housing prices they think
wow the economy must be doing well
people feel great
I have equity in my home I feel like I'm
making money but it's only on paper you
don't make anything until you sell a

that's debt you have to pay that back
and when we look at each city for each
individual in these cities if they

seven percent New York 95 percent Boston
eighty one percent and it's all
throughout these cities right now the
national average is six percent there's
no way that these people can purchase
these homes it's completely impossible
now let's add on to that that the
30-year fixed mortgage rate it is
increasing it's it's surging right now
so what does that mean well this is
coming from mortgage news daily the
mortgage rates surged to highest levels

it's going to take those people who are
looking for a house it's gonna take them

were screwed and they just left their

and we see right now the Fed yes is

they're moving very very quickly and
they're surging at this point so we see
right now that we have many things

we're gonna look at them and we're gonna

well
economists thought they were going to do
they were well below expectations they

it only makes up a small fraction of

now what they're saying is they don't

and we could see right now they don't

I like cryptocurrency I think it should
